intro: Mentha × nitida var. eschfaelleri, commonly known as the narrow-leaf catnip, is a hybrid plant belonging to the mint family (Lamiaceae). It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. It is native to Europe and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and aromatic properties. This variety is also valued for its use in herbal teas and traditional medicine.
